titleStmt.title: Alexander Curd and James Adkins to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6968

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlett
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

your petitioners Alexander Curd and James Adkins respectfully represent unto your Excellency that at the presant term of the Whitley Circuit Court they were fined Seventy five Dollars for having failed to put up in the public room of this Tavern house the tavern rates fixed by the County Court they state that they did not Know that it was made their duty by law to put up the rates and as soon as they learned it was their duty they procurred the rates from the clerk & set them up as required
We the undersigned ask to be heard in in behalf of the petitioners that your excellency May remit said fine

A R Barton
J, Q, Barton
S. M. Cox
Isam Jones
M, L, Davis
John White
Jackson Campbell
T J. Meddows
W. A. Champlin
Jackson M
David Y Lyttle
John shipherd
T R Harman
Alexr. Litton
Seth
J. T. Curd
H. McKee
H Bryant
W C cox
I hope that you will remit the fine against Curd & Adkins
Gov Bramlet Enclosed you find $2 as I find understand it is necesary to Send it for Some purpos thought dont know

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
Alexander Curd & James Adkins
Petition
$75,
Remit
20th Sept/65
